homes_hear_details: Alaska has not yet launched its HOMES or HEAR rebate programs. The Alaska Housing Finance Corporation (AHFC) is the designated state entity working with the U.S. Department of Energy to develop implementation plans for these IRA rebate programs.

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For Alaska, 80% of Area Median Income is adjusted for the high cost of living. In Anchorage, 80% AMI for a family of four is approximately $72,100. Remote areas may have different thresholds.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For Alaska, 150% of Area Median Income in Anchorage for a family of four is approximately $135,200.

net_metering: Alaska does not have a statewide net metering mandate. Some utilities, such as Chugach Electric Association and Matanuska Electric Association, offer net metering programs for small-scale renewable energy systems, typically up to 25 kW.

state_rebate_programs.name: AHFC Home Energy Rebate Program
state_rebate_programs.amount: Up to $10,000 based on energy rating improvement
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, windows, doors, heating systems, ventilation, air sealing. Rebate amount is tied to improvement in the home's energy rating (AKWarm rating).
state_rebate_programs.details: Homeowners must get a pre-upgrade and post-upgrade energy rating from a certified energy rater. The rebate is calculated based on the number of energy rating points improved. This is one of the longest-running state residential energy efficiency programs in the U.S.

state_rebate_programs.name: Weatherization Assistance Program
state_rebate_programs.amount: Average of approximately $15,000 per home (higher than national average due to cold climate)
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Air sealing, insulation, heating system repair/replacement, ventilation, windows, doors
state_rebate_programs.details: For income-qualifying households at or below 200% of federal poverty level. Alaska's program is more extensive than most states due to extreme cold climate conditions.

state_rebate_programs.name: Second Mortgage for Energy Conservation
state_rebate_programs.amount: Up to $30,000 as a second mortgage
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Energy efficiency improvements including insulation, windows, heating systems, and other qualifying measures
state_rebate_programs.details: Low-interest loan available to homeowners for energy efficiency improvements. Can be combined with the Home Energy Rebate Program.

programs.name: Residential Rebate Program
programs.amount: Varies by measure; up to $500 for heat pumps
programs.eligible_items: Cold-climate air source heat pumps, heat pump water heaters, LED lighting

programs.name: Member Rebate Program
programs.eligible_items: Energy-efficient heating equipment, cold-climate heat pumps

programs.name: Energy Efficiency Rebates
programs.eligible_items: Insulation, cold-climate heat pumps, efficient heating systems
